questions.question: What is the primary objective of email forensics?
options: Analyzing email metadata for fraud detection
questions.correct_answer: Analyzing email metadata for fraud detection

questions.question: What is one of the key pieces of information extracted during email header analysis?
questions.correct_answer: Sender's IP address

questions.question: What does email header analysis help investigators identify?
options: The exact time an email was sent
The device used to send the email
The server path taken by the email
questions.correct_answer: The server path taken by the email

questions.question: Which email forensic tool is commonly used for email content extraction and analysis?
questions.correct_answer: X1 Social Discovery

questions.question: What is email spoofing?
options: Sending a fake email with a forged sender address
Forwarding emails from an unknown sender
questions.correct_answer: Sending a fake email with a forged sender address

questions.question: Which of the following is often used to detect phishing in email forensics?
options: Analysis of email body content and links
questions.correct_answer: Analysis of email body content and links

questions.question: In email forensics, what does 'time-stamping' refer to?
options: Recording the time an email is delivered
Verifying the time the email was created or received
Tracking the time spent composing an email
questions.correct_answer: Verifying the time the email was created or received

questions.question: What does the term 'chain of custody' refer to in email forensics?
options: The process of transferring emails from one server to another
The legal documentation ensuring the integrity of email evidence
The analysis of email servers for forensic purposes
questions.correct_answer: The legal documentation ensuring the integrity of email evidence

questions.question: Which of the following could be an indicator of email fraud during forensic analysis?
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: What type of email metadata is crucial for tracing the origin of an email?
questions.correct_answer: Sender’s IP address

questions.question: What is the function of the 'Return-Path' in an email header?
options: Provides the physical address of the sender
Tracks the number of times the email is opened
questions.correct_answer: Indicates the email’s source

questions.question: Which forensic technique is commonly used to identify altered email content?
questions.correct_answer: Content hashing

questions.question: What type of email forensic evidence is often critical in criminal investigations?
questions.correct_answer: Metadata and attachments

questions.question: Which of the following could suggest that an email is part of a phishing scam?
options: The sender's email address is misspelled
The email contains an attachment with a suspicious file extension
The email prompts the recipient to click a link to verify personal information
questions.correct_answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the purpose of forensic email analysis in legal investigations?
options: To extract and present email evidence in court
To track spam and junk emails
questions.correct_answer: To extract and present email evidence in court

questions.question: Which technique can help in identifying forged email addresses?
questions.correct_answer: Analyzing email header information

questions.question: In email forensics, what is 'content-based analysis' focused on?
options: Checking if email content is encrypted
Analyzing email body and attachments for malicious links or malware
Analyzing the email header for IP addresses
questions.correct_answer: Analyzing email body and attachments for malicious links or malware

questions.question: What is the role of an email forensic investigator?
options: To analyze and recover email evidence
questions.correct_answer: To analyze and recover email evidence

questions.question: Which of the following is a common forensic tool used to extract data from email servers?
questions.correct_answer: EnCase

questions.question: Which of the following is important when conducting email forensics in a corporate setting?
options: Accessing private email servers without permission
Maintaining proper documentation and chain of custody
Ignoring encryption methods to expedite analysis
questions.correct_answer: Maintaining proper documentation and chain of custody
